data.title: Top 30 Dynatrace Competitors & Alternatives in 2024
data.meta_description: The top Dynatrace competitors are AppDynamics, New Relic, Datadog, SolarWinds, APM by Microsoft (Application Insights), Splunk, Sumo Logic and others.
data.text:
Dynatrace is a global technology company that provides a software observability platform based on artificial intelligence (AI) and automation. In this article, we discuss the top Dynatrace Competitors and Alternatives.

With its cutting-edge platform, Dynatrace enables organizations to monitor, optimize, and secure their digital ecosystems, ensuring optimal performance and superior user experiences. Unlike traditional monitoring tools, Dynatrace leverages artificial intelligence and automation to deliver real-time insights into application performance and customer interactions.

The Dynatrace platform offers comprehensive features that enable businesses to gain actionable insights across their entire IT environment. From cloud-native applications to complex multi-cloud infrastructures and environments, Dynatrace provides a unified view of IT operations, making it easier for organizations to identify and resolve performance issues quickly. By leveraging advanced analytics and AI-powered anomaly detection, Dynatrace empowers businesses to proactively address potential problems before they impact end users.

Product Type: Software observability platform

Industry: Technology

Headquarters: Waltham, Massachusetts, U.S.

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: John Van Siclen

Revenue: US$3.53 billion (2023)

Number of employees: 10,726 (June 2023)

The top Dynatrace competitors are

1. AppDynamics

Product Type: Application Performance Management (APM)

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2008

Founders: Jyoti Bansal

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: David Wadhwani

AppDynamics is an application performance management (APM) and IT operations analytics company. A constituent of the Cisco brand, AppDynamics provides real-time insights into application performance, user performance, and business performance. Its robust and versatile software suite allows businesses to track app health, user satisfaction levels, end-to-end business outcomes, and transactions, making it one of Dynatrace’s most significant competitors. Teams can easily visualize areas of complexity within their applications, enabling prompt action and response when anomalies occur.

2. New Relic

Product Type: Application Performance Management (APM)

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2008

Founders: Lew Cirne

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Bill Staples

Market capitalization: $5.5 billion (as of October 2023)

New Relic is a software analytics company that specializes in application performance monitoring. Renowned for offering real-time data on software performance and the business, New Relic lets developers diagnose and fix application issues quickly. Working on a cloud-based model, its digital intelligence platform provides actionable insights for software-driven enterprises regarding customer experience, software performance, operational intelligence, and the success of their digital initiatives.

3. Datadog

Product Type: Cloud Monitoring

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2010

Founders: Olivier Pomel, Alexis Lê-Quôc

Headquarters: New York City, New York, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Olivier Pomel

Market capitalization: $50 billion (as of October 2023)

Datadog is a monitoring service for cloud-scale applications. With features like infrastructure monitoring, log management, and application performance monitoring, Datadog brings together data from servers, databases, and third-party services. It offers businesses a unified view of their system, helping them avoid downtime, resolve performance issues, and ensure customers get the best user experience.

4. SolarWinds

Product Type: IT Management Software

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 1999

Founders: Donald Yonce, David Yonce

Headquarters: Austin, Texas, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Sudhakar Ramakrishna

Market capitalization: $10 billion (as of October 2023)

SolarWinds is a leading provider of powerful and affordable IT infrastructure management software. Renowned for its simplicity, SolarWinds delivers solutions to manage and monitor applications, networks, and systems, making it easier for businesses to identify and resolve issues. With its powerful suite of Software, SolarWinds stands as a formidable competitor in the industry.

5. APM by Microsoft (Application Insights)

Product Type: Application Performance Management (APM)

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 1975

Founders: Bill Gates, Paul Allen

Headquarters: Redmond, Washington, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Satya Nadella

Market capitalization: $2.5 trillion (as of October 2023)

APM by Microsoft (Application Insights) is a feature of Azure Monitor. Simply put, it’s an application performance management service for web developers. Application Insights offers insights into the performance and usage of your apps, whether they’re on-premises or Azure-based. A comprehensive view of how applications perform is instrumental in identifying and diagnosing issues in a web application.

6. Splunk

Product Type: Data Analytics

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2003

Founders: Erik Swan, Rob Das, Michael Baum

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Doug Merritt

Market capitalization: $30 billion (as of October 2023)

Splunk is a software company specializing in analyzing and visualizing machine data. Widely appreciated for making machine data accessible, usable, and valuable to everyone, Splunk offers tools that enable fact-based decision-making vital data everywhere. Splunk rivals Dynatrace in the digital landscape by converting machine data into answers.

7. Sumo Logic

Product Type: Cloud-based Log Management and Analytics

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2010

Founders: Christian Beedgen, Kumar Saurabh

Headquarters: Redwood City, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Ramin Sayar

Market capitalization: $2 billion (as of October 2023)

Sumo Logic is a cloud-based service for log management and combined data analytics. This platform allows businesses to troubleshoot operational and security issues by transforming raw log data into actionable insights. With its machine data analytics capability, Sumo Logic provides continuous intelligence, enabling real-time insights for IT operations, security, and business stakeholders.

8. Amazon CloudWatch

Product Type: Cloud Monitoring

Industry: Cloud Computing

Founded Date: 2006

Founders: Amazon.com

Headquarters: Seattle, Washington, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Andy Jassy

Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring and observability service built for DevOps engineers, developers, site reliability engineers (SREs), and IT managers. Provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS), CloudWatch effectively monitors applications, collects and tracks metrics, and gets automated responses to changes in your AWS environment. Its resource simplicity and robust monitoring ability make it a strong competitor.

9. LogicMonitor

Product Type: Cloud-based Infrastructure Monitoring

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2008

Founders: Steve Francis

Headquarters: Santa Barbara, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Kevin McGibben

LogicMonitor is a cloud-based, full-stack IT infrastructure monitoring tool. It enables businesses to maintain their IT infrastructure on-premises or in the cloud. Its automated device discovery and intuitive interface allow firms to reduce their operational costs, improve efficiency, and better forecast IT capacity planning, making LogicMonitor a robust player in the market and a competitor to Dynatrace.

10. ManageEngine Applications Manager

Product Type: Application Performance Management (APM)

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2002

Founders: Zoho Corporation

Headquarters: Pleasanton, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Sridhar Vembu

ManageEngine Applications Manager is an application performance management solution that helps businesses ensure their critical applications and servers are up and performing optimally. It comes with a broad range of monitoring capabilities, which includes performance monitoring for servers, databases, log files, applications, and websites. ManageEngine Applications Manager can monitor systems on-premise and in the cloud, making it a noteworthy competitor of Dynatrace.

11. Elastic (Elasticsearch)

Product Type: Enterprise Search and Analytics

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2012

Founders: Shay Banon

Headquarters: Mountain View, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Shay Banon

Market capitalization: $20 billion (as of October 2023)

Elastic (Elasticsearch) is a search and analytics engine that makes data accessible to query language exploration. Elasticsearch is widely used for real-time distributed search and analysis of big data, making it popular amongst organizations dealing with large amounts of information. It’s capable of searching diverse types of documents in a speedy manner, which positions it as a significant competitor to Dynatrace in terms of data management and analytics.

12. Cisco ThousandEyes

Product Type: Network Intelligence

Industry: Networking

Founded Date: 2010

Founders: Mohit Lad, Ricardo Oliveira

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Mohit Lad

Cisco ThousandEyes is a Network Intelligence platform that delivers visibility into every network an organization relies upon. Founded by engineers with extensive network development experience, ThousandEyes provides valuable insights into network behavior monitor performance, enabling organizations to deliver a high-quality digital experience. As part of the Cisco brand, it comes with high expectations and proves its status as a competitor to Dynatrace.

13. Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Product Type: Cloud Computing

Industry: Cloud Computing

Founded Date: 2006

Founders: Amazon.com

Headquarters: Seattle, Washington, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Andy Jassy

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a comprehensive cloud computing service provided by Amazon. AWS offers many services, including computing power, storage options, networking, and databases to help businesses grow and scale. Its extensive services, reliable performance, and scalability make it one of the biggest competitors of any software or service provider, including Dynatrace.

14. Instana

Product Type: Application Performance Management (APM)

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2015

Founders: Mirko Novakovic, Pavlo Baron, Fabian Lange, Pete Abrams

Headquarters: Chicago, Illinois, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Instana is a performance monitoring tool designed to manage performance in microservices and cloud-native applications. It automatically understands and monitors every service, endpoint, and underlying infrastructure component, providing the information needed to find and fix performance issues without reproducing the problem. These unique features make Instana a notable competitor of Dynatrace.

15. Sysdig

Product Type: Cloud Security and Monitoring

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2013

Founders: Loris Degioanni, Apurva Davé, Knox Anderson

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Suresh Vasudevan

Sysdig is a container intelligence platform that provides a clear view of what’s happening within containerized applications. Sysdig can secure, monitor, and troubleshoot these applications using the same data sources and workflows, making it particularly helpful for businesses implementing cloud-native technologies. Its emphasis on visibility and smooth operation makes Sysdig a sturdy competitor to Dynatrace.

16. Prometheus

Product Type: Open-source Monitoring System

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2012

Founders: Julius Volz, Björn Rabenstein, Fabian Reinartz

Headquarters: Berlin, Germany

Area Served: Worldwide

Prometheus is an open-source systems monitoring solution. With strong community support, it offers powerful querying synthetic monitoring capabilities, allowing for high-dimensional data collection. Prometheus is most commonly used for metrics and alerting, providing insights into operations and aiding on-call teams in handling incidents, marking it as another strong competitor.

17. Broadcom

Product Type: Semiconductors and Infrastructure Software

Industry: Technology

Founded Date: 1961

Founders: Henry Samueli, Henry Nicholas III

Headquarters: San Jose, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Hock Tan

Market capitalization: $200 billion (as of October 2023)

Broadcom is a giant multinational corporation that designs, develops, and supplies semiconductor and infrastructure software solutions. Broadcom’s extensive portfolio, global presence, and proven capabilities in the area of digital transformation make it a noteworthy competitor to Dynatrace.

18. Sentry

Product Type: Open-source Error Tracking

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2010

Founders: David Cramer, Chris Jennings

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Milin Desai

Sentry is an open-source application monitoring platform that helps teams discover, triage, and prioritize errors in real-time. With its ability to trace those problems to their root cause and provide the context to fix them quickly, Sentry plays a crucial role in application performance management. This positions it as a strong competitor to Dynatrace.

19. Sematext

Product Type: Cloud-based Log Management and Monitoring

Industry: Software

Founded Date: 2009

Founders: Otis Gospodnetic

Headquarters: Brooklyn, New York, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Otis Gospodnetic

Sematext is a full-stack observability solution for modern applications. Specializing in real-time performance monitoring, Sematext makes it easier for businesses to visualize key performance indicators, correlate them, and troubleshoot faster. With its easy-to-use and flexible ‘Software as a Service’ platform, Sematext delivers substantial value, staking its claim in the competitive landscape alongside Dynatrace.

20. Zabbix

Product Type: Network Monitoring Software

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 2001

Founders: Alexei Vladishev

Headquarters: Riga, Latvia

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Alexei Vladishev

Zabbix is an open-source monitoring software tool for diverse IT components, including networks, servers, virtual machines, and cloud services. Zabbix provides businesses with a dynamic and comprehensive monitoring solution with great flexibility. Zabbix’s innovative approach, scalability, and performance make it a pivotal competitor to firms like Dynatrace.

21. Paessler PRTG

Product Type: Network Monitoring Software

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 1997

Founders: Dirk Paessler

Headquarters: Nuremberg, Germany

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Dirk Paessler

Paessler PRTG is a comprehensive and powerful network monitoring tool. Utilized by businesses worldwide, PRTG provides real-time information on your IT infrastructure and enables you to avoid issues. Its ability to monitor all the systems, devices, traffic, and applications in your IT environment makes it a worthy competitor to Dynatrace.

22. Riverbed

Product Type: Network Performance Monitoring and Management

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 2002

Founders: Jerry Kennelly, Steve McCanne

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Paul Mountford

Market capitalization: $3.5 billion (as of October 13, 2023)

Riverbed is a technology company specializing in improving network performance and networked applications. Riverbed helps businesses leverage their IT infrastructure more effectively by making the network more efficient. Its emphasis on fluid IT operations makes Riverbed well-positioned as a competitor to Dynatrace.

23. Akamai (mPulse)

Product Type: Web Performance Monitoring and Optimization

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 1998

Founders: Tom Leighton, Daniel Lewin

Headquarters: Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Tom Leighton

Market capitalization: $18.5 billion (as of October 13, 2023)

Akamai (mPulse) is an actual user monitoring (RUM) software that gives visibility into the user’s experience and insights into performance impact on business goals. Akamai explains how page speed and website performance affect end-user monitoring behavior, helping businesses deliver superior digital experiences. This dedication to consumer experience makes it a worthy competitor to Dynatrace.

24. SigNoz

Product Type: Open-source Application Performance Monitoring

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 2020

Founders: Ankit Anand, Ranjit Singh

Headquarters: Bangalore, India

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Ankit Anand

SigNoz is an application monitoring platform using distributed tracing and metrics to aid businesses in optimizing their application performance in real-time. This open-source solution has robust deep data visibility, alerting, and troubleshooting features. As a result, SigNoz positions itself as an efficient alternative and competing solution to Dynatrace.

25. BMC Software

Product Type: Enterprise Software

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: September 1980

Founders: Scott Boulette, John J. Moores, and Dan Cloer

Headquarters: Houston, Texas, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Ayman Sayed

BMC Software is a leading provider of enterprise management solutions, offering innovative and comprehensive business and IT system management software. From mainframe to mobile, BMC delivers the automation, integration, and sophistication that enable businesses to perform like never before, hence standing as a competitor to Dynatrace.

26. IBM

Product Type: Enterprise Software, Hardware, and Services

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: June 16, 1911

Founders: Charles Ranlett Flint

Headquarters: Armonk, New York, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Arvind Krishna

Market capitalization: $150 billion (as of October 13, 2023)

IBM is a global technology company that provides various hardware, Software, and service solutions. IBM’s suite, which includes infrastructure, hosting, and consulting services in areas between applications to nanotechnology, architecture, and cloud, makes it a significant competitor in the industry.

27. NetBeez

Product Type: Network Monitoring and Performance Testing

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 2013

Founders: Panickos Neophytou, Stefano Gridelli, and Panos Vouzis

Headquarters: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Stefano Gridelli

NetBeez is a network monitoring solution enabling businesses to efficiently identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues for traditional and remote workers. NetBeez’s proactive network monitoring capability aligns itself well with the strong competitors of Dynatrace.

28. OpManager

Product Type: Network Monitoring and Management

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 2004

Founders: Girish Mathrubootham

Headquarters: Pleasanton, California, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Girish Mathrubootham

OpManager is a network and performance management software that helps businesses manage their servers and networks, ensure their infrastructure’s peak performance, and avoid downtime. Its comprehensive toolset and proactive monitoring style make it a strong contender in this competitive market.

29. AppNeta

Product Type: Application and Network Performance Monitoring

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: 2011

Founders: Matt Stevens, Dan Kuebrich, and Alec Pinkham

Headquarters: Boston, Massachusetts, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Matt Stevens

AppNeta is a network performance monitoring software that provides companies with complete visibility into their network, helping to provide an optimal end-user experience. Its emphasis on delivering end-to-end network performance data volume and insights makes it an essential player in the market.

30. Microsoft

Product Type: Enterprise Software, Hardware, and Services

Industry: Information Technology and Services

Founded Date: April 4, 1975

Founders: Bill Gates and Paul Allen

Headquarters: Redmond, Washington, United States

Area Served: Worldwide

Current CEO: Satya Nadella

Market capitalization: $2.5 trillion (as of October 13, 2023)

Microsoft is a multinational technology corporation that manufactures, licenses, and supports various software products, services, and devices. Microsoft has a variety of offerings in its portfolio that could rival Dynatrace in the monitoring log analytics and application performance management space, such as Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and System Center Operations Manager.

These were all the competitors of Dynatrace. If you know any other competitors, please write in the comments below.
